channel.title: How to PortForward (I felt random today!)
channel.description:
First of all you need to know what your external IP adress. So you can either click the little computer down their! And click support \ Then we need to know what type of router or motum you have. Im using lynksis. Okay open up your inter. \ Browser then type in 192.168.1.1 if using Lynksis. A pop-up should ask for password and user. Type \ in [code] Username: Admin [/code] \ and then \/ [code] Password: admin [/code] If it's not... your screwed. Then you should go to "Applications and Gaming" or "Advanced" and in "Advanced" Click forwarding. Type in format type... [code] HTTP or FTP [/code] Then the port. To port. Use [url=http://portforward.com]portforward.com[/url] To find your external IP adress for your IP. In "Applications of Gaming" is the same thing!
Hope I helped. ____________________________________________________________________________________________ Feed Back Please ____________________________________________________________________________________________ ~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~Drew~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~

item.title: How to PortForward (I felt random today!)
item.dc:creator: @Drew_Scape Drew_Scape
item.description:
@Drew_Scape wrote:

First of all you need to know what your external IP adress. So you can either click the little computer down their! And click support \ Then we need to know what type of router or motum you have. Im using lynksis. Okay open up your inter. \ Browser then type in 192.168.1.1 if using Lynksis. A pop-up should ask for password and user. Type \ in

Username: Admin
and then /

 Password: admin

If it’s not… your screwed. Then you should go to “Applications and Gaming” or “Advanced” and in “Advanced” Click forwarding. Type in format type…

 HTTP or FTP

Then the port. To port. Use portforward.com To find your external IP adress for your IP. In “Applications of Gaming” is the same thing!

Hope I helped.

Feed Back Please

Drew~~~~~~~~~~~~
